Intervention.evidence: Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (RYGB) and sleeve gastrectomy (SG) were superior to intensive medical therapy (IMT)

Objective.evidence: Objective: To investigate the long-term effects of medical and surgical treatments of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) on patient reported outcomes (PROs).

Method_Outcome.evidence: administered two generic health-related quality of life (QoL) questionnaires (RAND-36 and EQ-5D-3L) and a diabetes-specific instrument at baseline, and then on an annual basis up to 5-years after randomization.

Number_Randomised.evidence: a subset of 104 patients participating in the STAMPEDE trial

Result_Outcome.evidence: RYGB and SG significantly improved the domains of physical functioning, general health perception, energy/fatigue, and diabetes-related QoL compared with IMT group.
